com.satori.rtm

Interface RtmClient


  • public interface RtmClient
    An RtmClient is the main entry point for accessing RTM.

    To create an RTM client, use RtmClientBuilder. To connect a client to RTM, you must call start().

    By default, the RTM SDK attempts to reconnect to RTM if the connection to RTM fails for any reason. To disable this behavior, call RtmClientBuilder.setAutoReconnect().

    Operations performed when client is offline are queued and performed when the client reconnects to RTM. To disable this behaviour or change the length of this queue, call RtmClientBuilder.setPendingActionQueueLength().

    RtmClient instances are thread-safe so you can reuse them freely across multiple threads.

    This is an example of to use an RTM client to subscribe to a channel: 

    
 RtmClient client = new RtmClientBuilder(YOUR_ENDPOINT, YOUR_APPKEY)
   // Sets a listener for RTM lifecycle events
   .setListener(new RtmClientAdapter() {
      // When the client successfully connects to RTM
     &#64;Override
     public void onEnterConnected(RtmClient client) {
       System.out.println("Connected to Satori RTM!");
     }
   })
   // Builds the client instance
   .build();
 // Subscribe to "my_channel" and listen for incoming messages
 client.createSubscription("my_channel", SubscriptionMode.SIMPLE, new SubscriptionAdapter() {
   // Displays incoming messages
   &#64;Override
   public void onSubscriptionData(SubscriptionData data) {
     for (AnyJson json: data.getMessages()) {
       System.out.println("Got message: " + json);
     }
   }
 });
 // Connects the client to RTM
 client.start();

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
        Starts the client, which then tries to connect to RTM asynchronously.

        By default, the RTM SDK attempts to reconnect to RTM if the connection to RTM fails for any reason.

        To provide callbacks for events in the client or the connection lifecycle, call RtmClientBuilder.setListener(). For example, RtmClientListener.onEnterConnected() is called when the RTM client starts connecting to RTM.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the client.

        The RTM SDK tries to close the WebSocket connection asynchronously and doesn't start it again unless you call start().

        Use this method to explicitly stop all interaction with RTM. RtmClientListener.onEnterStopped() is called when the client enters the stopped state.

      • restart

        void restart()
        Restarts the client by calling stop() followed by start().

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Stops the client, terminates threads, and cleans up all allocated resources.

        After you call shutdown(), you can't use your RTM client.

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Returns true if the RTM client is completely connected.

        The client is connected when:

        • Connection to RTM is established
        • Authentication (if requested) is complete
        Returns:
        true if the client is completely connected, otherwise false

      • createSubscription

        void createSubscription(java.lang.String channel,
                        java.util.EnumSet<SubscriptionMode> modes,
                        SubscriptionListener listener)
        Creates a subscription to the specified channel.

        To create a subscription that has a streamfilter, call createSubscription().

        You can subscribe at any time. The RTM SDK manages the subscription and sends a subscribe request when the RTM client is connected. Use modes to tell the SDK how to resubscribe after a dropped connection.

        To provide callbacks for events in the subscription lifecycle, use SubscriptionListener.

        Parameters:
        channel - name of the channel
        modes - subscription modes
        listener - subscription listener
        See Also:
        SubscriptionAdapter

      • createSubscription

        void createSubscription(java.lang.String channelOrSubId,
                        SubscriptionConfig subscriptionConfig)
        Creates a subscription to the specified subscription id.

        This form of createSubscription lets you specify a streamfilter. See SubscriptionConfig.setFilter(). You set a SubscriptionListener and subscription modes in the SubscriptionConfig constructor.

        You can subscribe at any time. The RTM SDK manages the subscription and sends a subscribe request when the RtmClient is connected. Use the subscriptionConfig parameter to set various subscription options such as streamview, history, position, and so forth.

        If you don't specify a streamview in the configuration, channelOrSubId is treated as a channel name.

        Parameters:
        channelOrSubId - name of the channel or subscription id
        subscriptionConfig - subscription configuration

      • removeSubscription

        void removeSubscription(java.lang.String subscriptionId)
        Removes the subscription with the specific subscription id.

        Removing a subscription triggers related callbacks in SubscriptionListener. To set this listener, call createSubscription().

        Parameters:
        subscriptionId - subscription id

      • publish

        <T> com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Pdu<PublishReply>> publish(java.lang.String channel,
                                                                                  T message,
                                                                                  Ack ack)
        Publishes a message to a channel asynchronously.

        To get the response returned by RTM, call Future.get(), or pass ListenableFuture to Futures.addCallback(com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<V>, com.google.common.util.concurrent.FutureCallback<? super V>) to set up a callback.

        If the publish operation fails, then the exception is passed to the ListenableFuture object:

        • If you call ListenableFuture.get() to get the result, it throws an ExecutionException and passes the original exception to it.
        • If you call Futures.addCallback() to get the result, the exception is passed to FutureCallback.onFailure() unaltered.

        The publish operation can fail with the following execution exceptions:

        • IllegalStateException: RTM SDK failed to add the message to the pending queue because the queue is full.
        • PduException: an RTM error occured. For example, this exception is thrown if the client isn't authorized to publish to the specified channel.
        • TransportException: a WebSocket transport error occurred.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the message parameter
        Parameters:
        channel - name of the channel
        message - message to publish
        ack - determines if RTM should acknowledge the publish operation
        Returns:
        a PublishReply

      • getConnection

        Connection getConnection()
        Gets the current Connection.

        If the client isn't connected, this method returns null.

        Returns:
        Connection or null if client isn't connected.

      • read

        com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Pdu<ReadReply>> read(java.lang.String key)
        Reads the value of the specified key from a key-value store. The operation is asynchronous.

        The documentation for publish(String, Object, Ack) publish()} describes how to get the method response, and how to handle errors.

        Parameters:
        key - key name
        Returns:
        result of the read operation, returned asynchronously
        See Also:
        publish(String, Object, Ack)

        The documentation for publish() describes how to get the method response, and how to handle errors.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        asynchronous result of the read request

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        asynchronous result of the delete request

      • search

        void search(java.lang.String prefix,
            Callback<Pdu<SearchReply>> callback)
        Returns all channels that have a name that starts with prefix asynchronously.

        This method passes RTM replies to the callback. RTM may send multiple responses to the same search request: zero or more search result PDUs with an action of `rtm/search/data` (depending on the results of the search). After the search result PDUs, RTM follows with PDU with an action of `rtm/search/ok`.

        Parameters:
        prefix - channels prefix.
        callback - callback that's invoked when the SDK receives a response from RTM
